#include <iostream>

int main() {
    int t,n,w[30],c[30];
    
    scanf("%d",&t);
    
    while(t--)
    {
        scanf("%d",&n);
        
        //taking in the weights and capacities in aray w[] and c[] repectively.
        for(int i=0;i<n;i++)
        {
            scanf("%d",&w[i]);
        }
        for(int i=0;i<n;i++)
        {
            scanf("%d",&c[i]);
        }
        
        //sorting the capacity array using bubble sort
        for(int i=0;i<n;i++)
        {
            int temp;
            for(int j=0;j<n-1-i;j++)
            {
                if (c[j+1]<c[j])
                {
                    temp=c[j];
                    c[j]=c[j+1];
                    c[j+1]=temp;
                }
                
            }
        }
        
        int find,count=0;
        
        //checking if a capacity larger than the current weight is available. If yes, don't look any further and check for the next weight.
        for(int i=0;i<n;i++)
        {
            find=w[i];
            for(int j=0;j<n;j++)
            {
                if (c[j]>=find)
                {
                    count++;
                    c[j]=0;
                    break;
                }
            }
        }
        
        printf("%d\n",count);
    }
}
